original: Ågren, Per Gustaf, direktör, kapten, Göteborg, f. 20/6/98 i Gbg av grossh. Axel Hugo Å. o. Louise Schmidt. G. 28 m. Märtha Winqwist. Barn: Louise f. 31, Birgitta 33, Kristina 35, Ann-Charlotte 39, Axel Hugo 42. — Stud:-ex. v. Gbgs h. real 18, of;f :ex. 20, AIHIS allm. art:kurs 23, DHG 31. Fänrik v. Göta art:reg. 20, löjtn. 24, kapten i res. 35. Anst. v. Axel H. Ågren A-B i Gbg s’ed. 31, dir. där sed. 34. Styr:led. i Gbgs Sand A-B, i Sodafabr. Försäljn. A-B, i Gbgs spar^b., i Ränte- o. Kap :-försäkr :anst. i Gbg, ordf. i Gbgs o. Boh. 1. skytteför<b. fr. 38, Skytteföi^b. ord. repr. i Bef :ut!b :förb. fr. 38, led. av en mängd komm. o. ndr inom skytterör., ledare f. SM på armégev. i Gbg 38, f. Gbgs o. Boh. 1. skytteförib. jub:tävl. i Gbg 43, v. ordf. i Res:off :sällsk. i Gbg 37-45, ordlf. sed. 46, styr:led. i Sv. arméns o. flygv. res :off :förb. sed. 46. Holbbies: skytte, ridsp. RVO, Skytteförb. öv:-styr. ftjSM, Gbgs o. Boh. 1. skytteförb. ftjGM, RFinlLolkl 47, FMM f. hum. verks., Finl. res :off :förb. Hed-Gt, De Vernepl. off. foren. i Oslo Hed-Gt.
translated: Ågren, Per Gustaf, director, captain, Gothenburg, b. 20/6/98 in Gothenburg to wholesale merchant Axel Hugo Å. and Louise Schmidt. Married on the 28th to Märtha Winqwist. Children: Louise b. 31, Birgitta b. 33, Kristina b. 35, Ann-Charlotte b. 39, Axel Hugo b. 42. - Studied at Gothenburg Higher Real School, graduated in 1918; Officer's Exam in 1920; General Art Course at AIHIS in 1923; DHG (Society for the Dissemination of General and Practical Knowledge) in 1931. Ensign in the Gotha Artillery Regiment in 1920, lieutenant in 1924, captain in the reserves in 1935. Employed by Axel H. Ågren A-B in Gothenburg since 1931, director since 1934. Board member of Gothenburg Sand A-B, of Soda Factory Sales A-B, of Gothenburg Savings Bank, of Interest and Capital Insurance Institution in Gothenburg. Chairman of Gothenburg and Bohus County 1st Shooting Association since 1938; Ordinary representative in the National Shooting Association since 1938. Member of various committees and associations within the shooting field. Leader of the Swedish Championship on army rifle in Gothenburg in 1938, organizer of the Gothenburg and Bohus County 1st Shooting Association Jubilee Competition in Gothenburg in 1943. Vice chairman of the Reserve Officers' Society in Gothenburg from 1937-1945, chairman since 1946. Board member of the Swedish Army and Air Force Reserve Officers' Association since 1946. Hobbies: shooting, equestrian sports. Holder of the Royal Order of Vasa, Chief of the Shooting Association Honorary Staff, First-Class Medal of Merit in Gold of Gothenburg and Bohus County 1st Shooting Association, Commander 4th Class of the Order of the White Rose of Finland, Member of the Society for the Promotion of Humane Actions, Honorary Member of the Finnish Reserve Officers' Association.
